page.title: 01Principal Features
page.content:
Principal Features.
Moretonhampstead is a small moorland town that lies on the Eastern slopes of Dartmoor.It is a crossroads for most of the traffic that travels on the moors.Two buildings of note stand out:the Almshouses and the Church which dominates the surrounding area.Most of the other buildings are more recent having been replaced after fire.Near Moreton there are several tors such as Houndtor,Haytor and many others.The Almhouses were built in 1637 AD on the site of a medival hospital.The nave of the Church was built in the 14th century,the chancel was built in the 20th century and the rest of the church was built in the 15th century.The tower is approximatly 90 feet high.
